newsitem.title: USA: Gensia to collaborate in diabetes research.
newsitem.headline: Gensia to collaborate in diabetes research.

text.p: Gensia Sicor Inc said it signed an agreement with Sankyo Co Ltd in Japan to collaborate in developing drugs for non-insulin dependent diabetes.
It said the research will focus on a class of novel compounds that work on an enzyme that plays a role in glucose production in the liver.
Under terms of the agreement, Gensia will receive license fees, equity investment, and research funding for three years along with milestone payments from Sankyo, plus royalties on product sales.
Sankyo will have exclusive worldwide commercialization rights to all products discovered in the collaboration.
